title: Hextech Amumu Splash-Art is heartbreaking
body:
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/223160598911778817/622120627590922240/IMG_20190913_182428.jpg

He's put away because the kid doesn't want him anymore.

{{champion:32}}  is even trying to wipe his own tears..

AHHHHHH right in the feels, why Riot?

replies.body:
It really evokes the old Sewn Chaos Amumu splash 

https://cdnb.artstation.com/p/assets/images/images/004/717/787/large/jem-flores-sewnchaosamublitz-post.jpg?1485770224

I mean a Rammus toy as a kid sounds pretty dope. Can you imagine revving that bad boy up and tearing up the cul-de-sac, having a toy like that would've made me the envy of my friends.

Maybe that Amumu should just be better. =P
Are all the hextech skins toys? The kid kinda looks like Annie playing with Tibbers. What if the whole skin line is just her toys?

Not all of them are toys, no.

{{champion:12}} His bio states that he is a Hextech golem designed to protect the secrets of Hextech and it's artificers.
{{champion:3}} Is a gigantic Hextech golem, built to protect Piltover and it's people (basically the same base Galio does for Demacia).
{{champion:78}} She is one of the artificers and a really crafty one, currently she tries to create a complete artificial soul.
{{champion:90}} Basically is a herald of Hextech now, trying to spread it's greatness after discovering the secret behind it (most likely he found out what the Hextech crystals really are).
{{champion:59}} A warrior who tried to improve his fighting skills by utilising modern technology.
{{champion:58}} Seems to be some kind of experiment for uses on the battlefield, but it seems it is not controllable.
{{champion:1}} Artificer who created a new type of "warbears". So it seems that Tibbers is not a toy but a living warmachine.
_______________

Also some outdated onces:
{{champion:27}} Augmented himself to become a monster.
{{champion:40}} Exposure to Hextech granted her the ability to fly and control wind, it seems....?
{{champion:14}} Experiment to bring back the dead by using Hextech.

_______________

There definitely are some toys among them, especially aimed for the high society of Piltover. But not all of them are toys.

Well, I just mentioned every Hextech skin that is without doubt not meant as a toy.
Anivia's skin bio states that she is the first Hextech capable of limited speech.
>Early hextech lifeforms could barely be considered sentient... until the development of Anivia, an artificial avian capable of limited speech. Her birth was the foundation of the modern Hextech movement, and the multitude of creatures that came after her. 

We can not directly tell from this text if Anivia is meant as a toy or not... For example, Kog'Maw is also an artificial Hextech being, but he is definitely meant for the amusement of Piltover's high society. The same _could_ apply to Anivia, hence why I didn't mention her.
